abstract.p: China publishes new regulations that require all companies providing Internet content to apply for licenses within two months; rules also say that proportion of foreign investment in Chinese Internet concerns must conform with laws and administrative regulations, implying that much of foreign investment in Chinese Internet ventures is illegal (S)

block.p: China has published new regulations that require all companies providing Internet content to apply for licenses within two months. The rules also say that the proportion of foreign investment in Chinese Internet concerns must conform with laws and administrative regulations, implying that much of the foreign investment in Chinese Internet ventures is illegal. Those laws ban all foreign investment in the industry and restrict foreign ownership to 49 percent of Chinese Internet ventures after the country joins the World Trade Organization. But many Chinese Internet companies already have a majority foreign ownership.
